entry.title: The Ministerial and other Salaries Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Ministerial and other Salaries Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order makes provision for increases in the salaries payable under section 1(1), (3) and (3A) of the Ministerial and other Salaries Act 1975 (the 1975 Act) over and above the increases payable by virtue of the uprating formula in section 1A of the 1975 Act. The salaries covered by sections 1(1), (3) and (3A) are those of Ministers, Opposition Leaders and Whips and other office-holders listed in Schedule 1 to the 1975 Act, and the Commons and Lord Speakers.

entry.title: The International Tax Enforcement (Bermuda) Order 2008
entry.summary: An Arrangement dealing with the exchange of information for tax purposes between the United Kingdom and the British Overseas Territory of Bermuda (“the Arrangement”) is set out in the Schedule to this Order.

entry.title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (New Zealand) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (New Zealand) Order 2008

entry.summary: The Protocol scheduled to this Order makes certain alterations to the Convention signed at London on 4 August 1983, as amended by the Protocol signed at London on 4 November 2003.

entry.title: The Scotland Act 1998 (Transfer of Functions to the Scottish Ministers etc.) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Scotland Act 1998 (Transfer of Functions to the Scottish Ministers etc.) Order 2007

entry.summary: This Order, made under the Scotland Act 1998 provides for certain functions of a Minister of the Crown, so far as they are exercisable in or as regards Scotland, to be exercisable by the Scottish Ministers concurrently with the Minister concerned.

entry.title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (Slovenia) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (Slovenia) Order 2008

entry.summary: A Convention dealing with the avoidance of double taxation and fiscal evasion between the United Kingdom and the Republic of Slovenia (“the Convention”) is set out in the Schedule to this Order.

entry.title: The Parliamentary Constituencies and Assembly Electoral Regions (Wales) (Amendment) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Parliamentary Constituencies and Assembly Electoral Regions (Wales) (Amendment) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order gives effect, without modifications, to the recommendations contained in the report submitted to the Secretary of State by the Boundary Commission for Wales on 31st January 2008 (“the report”) with respect to the areas comprised in the constituencies of Brecon and Radnorshire, and Neath (HC 588).

entry.title: The Alternative Finance Arrangements (Community Investment Tax Relief) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Alternative Finance Arrangements (Community Investment Tax Relief) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order amends Chapter 5 of Part 2 of the Finance Act 2005 in order to allow alternative finance arrangements that fall within section 47, 49 or 49A of the Finance Act 2005 to be treated as loans for the purposes of Community Investment Tax Relief (CITR).

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Liner Conferences) (Gibraltar) (Repeal) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order provides for the mandatory provisions of the United Nations Code of Conduct for Liner Conferences, as implemented in Gibraltar by the Merchant Shipping (Liner Conferences) (Gibraltar) Order 1985, to cease to have effect, and makes consequential repeals.

entry.title: The Scotland Act 1998 (Agency Arrangements) (Specification) (No. 2) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order specifies, for the purposes of section 93(1) of the Scotland Act 1998, a function of the Secretary of State and also a function of the Scottish Ministers. Section 93(1) allows the Scottish Ministers to make arrangements for any of their specified functions to be exercised on their behalf by a Minister of the Crown, and for a Minister of the Crown to make arrangements for any of his specified functions to be exercised on his behalf by the Scottish Ministers.

entry.title: The Films Co-Production Agreements (Amendment) Order 2008
entry.summary: The Films Co-Production Agreements Order 1985 (“the principal Order”) provides that films made in accordance with the agreements between the Government of the United Kingdom and the Governments of other countries listed in the Schedule are to be treated as British films for the purposes of Schedule 1 to the Films Act 1985. This Order extends the list of agreements scheduled to the principal Order to include an agreement with India of 5th December 2005 (Cm. 7423). The agreement with India was laid before Parliament on 17th June 2008 and is available from the Foreign and Commonwealth Office website: www.fco.gov.uk. This Order also revokes a previous Order which amended the Schedule to the principal Order and has now been superseded.

entry.title: The European Communities (Designation) (No. 2) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order designates the Secretary of State so that the Secretary of State may exercise the powers conferred by section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 (c. 68) (“section 2(2)”) in relation to private international law. It also designates the Treasury so that it may exercise the powers conferred by section 2(2) in relation to payment services. The Order also designates the Welsh Ministers so that they may exercise the powers conferred by section 2(2) in relation to the veterinary and phytosanitary fields for the protection of public health. This Order also revokes several existing designations which have now been superseded.

entry.title: The Welsh Ministers (Transfer of Functions) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 58 of, and paragraph 2 of Schedule 4 to, the Government of Wales Act 2006 (c.32) and comes into force on the day after it is made.

entry.title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (Saudi Arabia) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (Saudi Arabia) Order 2008

entry.summary: A Convention dealing with the avoidance of double taxation and fiscal evasion between the United Kingdom and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (“the Convention”) is set out in the Schedule to this Order.

entry.title: The Sexual Offences (Northern Ireland Consequential Amendments) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Sexual Offences (Northern Ireland Consequential Amendments) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to the law of the United Kingdom which are consequential on the Sexual Offences (Northern Ireland) Order 2008.

entry.title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (Moldova) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Double Taxation Relief and International Tax Enforcement (Taxes on Income and Capital) (Moldova) Order 2008

entry.summary: A Convention dealing with the avoidance of double taxation and fiscal evasion between the United Kingdom and the Republic of Moldova (“the Convention”) is set out in the Schedule to this Order.

entry.title: The Mental Capacity (Deprivation of Liberty: Standard Authorisations, Assessments and Ordinary Residence) Regulations 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Mental Capacity (Deprivation of Liberty: Standard Authorisations, Assessments and Ordinary Residence) Regulations 2008

entry.summary: The Mental Capacity Act 2005 (“the Act”) provides for the deprivation of liberty of people lacking capacity to consent to the arrangements made for their care or treatment, who are receiving care or treatment in care homes and hospitals, where authorisation under section 4A of and Schedule A1 to the Act (“Schedule A1”) exists.

title.div: The Local Authorities (Conduct of Referendums) (Wales) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Cynnal Refferenda) (Cymru) 2008

div.p: These Regulations re-enact Regulations of the same name made in 2004 (S.I. 2004/870 (W.85)) (“the 2004 Regulations”), with necessary amendments, to make provision for the conduct of referendums to be held under section 27 of the Local Government Act 2000 (c. 22) (“the 2000 Act”), or by virtue of regulations or an order made under any provision of Part II of the 2000 Act. These Regulations apply in relation to Wales. The referendums will relate to the question of whether a county or county borough council should adopt executive arrangements that include a mayor and cabinet executive, a mayor and council manager executive or a leader and cabinet executive. The Regulations also prescribe certain forms for use at a referendum under the Welsh Language Act 1993.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn ailddeddfu rheoliadau o'r un enw a wnaed yn 2004 (O.S. 2004/870 (Cy.85)) (“Rheoliadau 2004”), gyda diwygiadau angenrheidiol i ddarparu ar gyfer cynnal refferenda sydd i'w cynnal o dan adran 27 o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 2000 (p.22) (“Deddf 2000”), neu yn rhinwedd rheoliadau neu orchymyn a wneir o dan unrhyw ddarpariaeth o Ran II o Ddeddf 2000. Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gymwys mewn perthynas â Chymru. Bydd y refferenda yn ymwneud â'r cwestiwn p'un ai trefniadau gweithrediaeth o faer a chabinet, gweithrediaeth o faer a rheolwr y cyngor neu weithrediaeth o arweinydd a chabinet y dylai cyngor sir neu gyngor bwrdeistref sirol eu mabwysiadu. Mae'r Rheoliadau hefyd yn rhagnodi ffurfiau penodol sydd i'w defnyddio mewn refferendwm o dan Ddeddf yr Iaith Gymraeg 1993.

entry.title: The Health Care and Associated Professions (Miscellaneous Amendments) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Health Care and Associated Professions (Miscellaneous Amendments) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order makes various amendments to the framework legislation for the regulation of doctors, opticians, osteopaths and chiropractors. Many of the amendments relate to the governance arrangements for the regulatory bodies that regulate those professions. Many of the changes result either in the standardising of practice across the regulatory bodies or in bringing their practice more closely into line with each other.

entry.title: The Immigration (Notices) (Amendment) (No.2) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Immigration (Notices) Regulations 2003 to ensure that certain provisions about the notice, content and service of immigration decisions apply where the Secretary of State decides that the automatic deportation provisions of the UK Borders Act 2007 (section 32(5)) apply to a person.

entry.title: The North Tees Teaching Primary Care Trust (Change of Name) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order amends the North Tees Primary Care Trust (Establishment) Order 2001.
